description: Triangle giving coefficients of ménage hit polynomials.
comments: Triangle of coefficients of polynomials P(n; x) = Permanent(M), where M=[m(i,j)] is n X n matrix defined by m(i,j)=x if 0<=i-j<=1 else m(i,j)=1. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jan 23 2003
references: J. Riordan, An Introduction to Combinatorial Analysis, Wiley, 1958, p. 198.
links: T. D. Noe, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened
maple: V := proc(n) local k; add( binomial(2*n-k,k)*(n-k)!*(x-1)^k, k=0..n); end; W := proc(r,s) coeff( V(r),x,s ); end; a := (n,k)->W(n,n-k);
mathematica: max = 9; f[x_, y_] := Sum[n!*((x*y)^n/(1 + x*(y-1))^(2*n+1)), {n, 0, max}]; Flatten[ MapIndexed[ Take[#1, #2[[1]]] & , CoefficientList[ Series[f[x, y], {x, 0, max}, {y, 0, max}], {x, y}]]] (*_Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 29 2012, after _Vladeta Jovovic_ *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 02 2000
